ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
The Ribasim Python package (named `ribasim`) aims to make it easy to build, update and
analyze Ribasim models programmatically.

The Ribasim QGIS plugin allows users to construct a model from scratch without programming.
For specific tasks, like adding observed rainfall timeseries, it can be faster to use
Python instead.

One can also use Ribasim Python to build entire models from base data, such that your model
setup is fully reproducible.

For documentation please see the [examples](https://deltares.github.io/Ribasim/python/examples.html) and [API reference](https://deltares.github.io/Ribasim/python/reference/).

The Ribasim Python package (named `ribasim`) aims to make it easy to build, update and
analyze Ribasim models programmatically.

The Ribasim QGIS plugin allows users to construct a model from scratch without programming.
For specific tasks, like adding observed rainfall timeseries, it can be faster to use
Python instead.

One can also use Ribasim Python to build entire models from base data, such that your model
setup is fully reproducible.

For documentation please see the [examples](https://deltares.github.io/Ribasim/python/examples.html) and [API reference](https://deltares.github.io/Ribasim/python/reference/).

name: ribasim
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set python_min = "3.12" %}
{% set name = "ribasim" %}
{% set version = "2025.6.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: c1893f195a9f948bf5a1d0116e42f0b46f7c0139de5947b69f286bd97d50fd20

build:
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - hatchling
    - pip
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - datacompy >=0.16
    - geopandas >=1.0
    - matplotlib-base >=3.9
    - netcdf4 >=1.7.1
    - numpy >=2.0
    - packaging >=23.0
    - pandas >=2.2
    - pandera >=0.25
    - pyarrow >=17.0
    - pydantic >=2.0
    - pyogrio >=0.8
    - shapely >=2.0
    - tomli >=2.0
    - tomli-w >=1.0
    - xarray >=2023.11

test:
  imports:
    - ribasim
  requires:
    - pip
    - python {{ python_min }}
  commands:
    - pip check

about:
  home: https://deltares.github.io/Ribasim/
  summary: Pre- and post-process Ribasim
  description: |
    The Ribasim Python package (named `ribasim`) aims to make it easy to build, update and
    analyze Ribasim models programmatically.

    The Ribasim QGIS plugin allows users to construct a model from scratch without programming.
    For specific tasks, like adding observed rainfall timeseries, it can be faster to use
    Python instead.

    One can also use Ribasim Python to build entire models from base data, such that your model
    setup is fully reproducible.

    For documentation please see the [examples](https://deltares.github.io/Ribasim/python/examples.html) and [API reference](https://deltares.github.io/Ribasim/python/reference/).
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  doc_url: https://deltares.github.io/Ribasim/python/
  dev_url: https://github.com/Deltares/Ribasim/tree/main/python/ribasim

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - FMSST
    - evetion
    - SouthEndMusic
    - visr
    - Huite
